questions.stem: Compound (X) undergoes following sequence of reactions to give the Lactone (Y). Identify the correct structure of (Y).
questions.explanation: The compound undergoes aldol condensation followed by cyanohydrin formation and acid hydrolysis to form the lactone. The correct structure shows a six-membered lactone ring with appropriate substituents.
questions.tip_formula: Aldol condensation → Cyanohydrin → Acid hydrolysis → Lactonization
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Assertion A: Hydrolysis of an alkyl chloride is a slow reaction but in the presence of NaI, the rate of the hydrolysis increases. Reason R: I⁻ is a good nucleophile as well as a good leaving group. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

options.text: A is false but R is true
A is true but R is false
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A

questions.explanation: Alkyl chlorides hydrolyze slowly due to poor nucleophilicity of water. I⁻ is a better nucleophile than Cl⁻ and can displace Cl⁻ to form alkyl iodide, which then hydrolyzes faster due to the better leaving ability of I⁻.
questions.tip_formula: Nucleophilicity order: I⁻ > Br⁻ > Cl⁻; Leaving ability: I⁻ > Br⁻ > Cl⁻
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Order of Covalent bond: A. KF > KI; LiF > KF B. KF < KI; LiF > KF C. SnCl₄ > SnCl₂; CuCl > NaCl D. LiF > KF; CuCl < NaCl E. KF < KI; CuCl > NaCl. Which of the following options correctly identifies the true statements?
questions.explanation: According to Fajan's rule, covalent character increases with smaller cation size, larger anion size, and higher charge on ions. B: KF < KI (true, larger anion), LiF > KF (true, smaller cation). C: SnCl₄ > SnCl₂ (true, higher charge), CuCl > NaCl (true, pseudo noble gas configuration). E: KF < KI (true), CuCl > NaCl (true).
questions.tip_formula: Fajan's Rule: Covalent character ∝ (Charge on cation × Charge on anion) / (Size of cation + Size of anion)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Increasing order of stability of the resonance structures is:
questions.explanation: The correct order of stability is C < D < A < B. Structure C has charge separation and incomplete octet, D has charge separation but complete octet, A has less charge separation, B has no charge separation and complete octets.
questions.tip_formula: Resonance stability order: Complete octet > No charge separation > Less charge separation > More charge separation
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The magnetic moment of a transition metal compound has been calculated to be 3.87 B.M. The metal ion is
questions.explanation: Magnetic moment μ = √[n(n+2)] B.M. For μ = 3.87, n(n+2) = 15, so n = 3. V²⁺ has electronic configuration [Ar] 3d³ with 3 unpaired electrons.
questions.tip_formula: Magnetic moment: μ = √[n(n+2)] B.M., where n = number of unpaired electrons
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Match List I with List II: List I (Furnace/Process) - A. Reverberatory furnace, B. Electrolytic cell, C. Blast furnace, D. Zone Refining furnace; List II (Application) - I. For semiconductors: Si, II. Hematite to Pig Iron, III. For reactive metal: Al, IV. Roasting of Copper

options.text: A – IV, B – II, C – I, D – III
A – I, B – IV, C – II, D – III
A – I, B – III, C – II, D – IV
A – IV, B – III, C – II, D – I

questions.explanation: Reverberatory furnace is used for roasting of copper (A-IV). Electrolytic cell is used for reactive metals like aluminum (B-III). Blast furnace is used for hematite to pig iron (C-II). Zone refining furnace is used for semiconductors like silicon (D-I).
questions.tip_formula: Metallurgy processes: Reverberatory → Cu roasting; Electrolytic → Al extraction; Blast furnace → Fe production; Zone refining → Si purification
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: It is observed that characteristic X-ray spectra of elements show regularity. When frequency to the power 'n' i.e. νⁿ of X-rays emitted is plotted against atomic number 'Z', a straight line is obtained. The value of 'n' is
questions.explanation: According to Moseley's law: √ν ∝ Z or ν ∝ Z². Therefore, when ν¹/² is plotted against Z, a straight line is obtained. So n = 1/2.
questions.tip_formula: Moseley's Law: √ν = a(Z - b) or ν ∝ Z²
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the Phosphorus oxoacid can create silver mirror from AgNO₃ solution?
questions.explanation: H₄P₂O₅ (hypophosphoric acid) contains P-H bonds which can reduce Ag⁺ to Ag, creating silver mirror. Other oxoacids lack P-H bonds.
questions.tip_formula: Only phosphorus oxoacids with P-H bonds can reduce Ag⁺ to Ag (Tollen's test)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The primary and secondary valencies of cobalt respectively in [Co(NH₃)₅Cl]Cl₂ are:
questions.explanation: Primary valency = oxidation state = +3 (as 2Cl⁻ ions are outside coordination sphere). Secondary valency = coordination number = 6 (5 NH₃ + 1 Cl⁻ in coordination sphere).
questions.tip_formula: Primary valency = Oxidation state; Secondary valency = Coordination number
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: An ammoniacal metal salt solution gives a brilliant red precipitate on addition of dimethylglyoxime. The metal ion is:
questions.explanation: Ni²⁺ forms a brilliant red precipitate with dimethylglyoxime (DMG) in ammoniacal medium. The complex formed is [Ni(DMG)₂].
questions.subject: Chemistry
